common.name: Name
common.confirmDeleteText: Are you sure that you want to delete this __type__?

modules.title: Authentication Modules
modules.description: OpenAM uses authentication modules to identify the user. Normally authentication modules are associated with an authentication chain. Each realm has a default authentication chain that will be used to authenticate users. This section is used to add, configure or remove authentication module available for authentication into this realm.

inUse.title: Edit module
inUse.message:
The __moduleName__ module is being used by the following Authentication Chain(s) __usedChains__. Editing this module may change their behaviour.

Are you sure you want to continue?

modules.moduleNameValidationError: Spaces are not allowed in a module's name
modules.confirmDeleteSelected: Are you sure you want to delete the selected module?
modules.confirmDeleteSelected_plural: Are you sure you want to delete the selected modules?

chains.title: Authentication Chains
chains.description: Use authentication chains to define the steps a subject takes to authenticate. Authentication chains consist of a series of one or more authentication modules, with credentials being passed down the chain to each module instance.
chains.duplicateChain: A Chain with the same name already exists
chains.confirmDeleteSelected: Are you sure you want to delete the selected chain?
chains.confirmDeleteSelected_plural: Are you sure you want to delete the selected chains?

editChains.redirectUrlsHelp: Specify the URL to which the subject is redirected. You can specify separate URLs for authenticating successfully and when authentication fails.
editChains.moduleHelp: Add authentication modules to build a process in which a user must pass credentials to all module instances.

processingClass.title: Post Authentication Processing Class

addClassNameDialog.title: Add new Class Name
addClassNameDialog.message: The new class name <mark>__newClassName__</mark> for Post Authentication Processing has not been saved. Do you want to save it?

processingClass.duplicateClass: A Class with the same name already exists
processingClass.help: Specify the name of a Java class to execute at the end of the authentication process.

criteria.title: Required
criteria.passText: Pass this module and you will get a pass flag, and continue in the chain.
criteria.failText: Fail this module and you will get a fail flag, and continue in the chain.

criteria.title: Optional
criteria.passText: Pass this module and you will get a pass flag, and continue in the chain.
criteria.failText: Fail this module and you will continue in the chain.

criteria.title: Requisite
criteria.passText: Pass this module and you will get a pass flag, and continue in the chain.
criteria.failText: Fail this module and you will get a fail flag, and exit the chain.

criteria.title: Sufficient
criteria.passText: Pass this module and you will get a pass flag, and exit the chain.
criteria.failText: Fail this module and you will continue in the chain.

alerts.reqdFailSuffPass: Warning: Passing a SUFFICIENT module after the failing a REQUIRED module will continue through the chain and will not exit at that point. Consider using REQUISITE instead of REQUIRED.

editChains.callToAction: You must add at least one authentication module
editChains.lastCriteria: Will advance to success or failure URL

deleteBtnTooltip.defaultAdminAuthChain: This is the default authentication chain for Administrators.
deleteBtnTooltip.defaultOrgAuthChain: This is the default authentication chain for Organizations.
deleteBtnTooltip.defaultAdminOrgAuthChain: This is the default authentication chain for Administrators and Organizations.

realms.title: Realms
realms.description: Use realms to organize subjects and configuration data. Within each realm you can configure data stores, administration privileges, authentication chains, authorization policies, and other realm-specific settings.
realms.parentRealmCannotDeleted: Parent-realms cannot be deleted. Please delete any sub-realms first.

warningDialog.title: Delete "__realmName__"?
warningDialog.activateMessage:
This is an active realm. All configuration data will be lost if deleted. You can set the realm as inactive to prevent login but retain configuration data.
Do you want to delete this realm?
warningDialog.deactivateMessage:
This is an inactive realm. No one can currently login. All configuration data will be lost if deleted.
Are you sure you want to delete this realm?

realmStatusPopover.title: Realm Status
realmStatusPopover.content: If the realm is inactive, all OpenAM services will be unavailable for all users in this realm.

realmAliasesPopover.title: Realm/DNS Aliases
realmAliasesPopover.content:
When a request is received by the authentication user interface, OpenAM searches this attribute in all realms to find the matching realm into which the user should be authenticated.
OpenAM must only find one matching realm so therefore do not put duplicate entries into multiple realms.
Additionally if OpenAM does not find a matching realm, the user is presented with an error screen.

realms.realmNameValidationError: Characters $, &, +, comma, /, :, ;, =, ?, @, space, #, %% are not allowed in a realm's name

dialog.helper: To create a new script, first select one of the available script types.
dialog.warning: By changing the script type you will lose any unsaved data.

list.title: Scripts List
list.confirmDeleteText: Are you sure you want to delete the selected scripts?

common.noApplications: There are no selected policy sets...
common.noResourceTypesAvailable: There are no available resource types...
common.noApplicationsAvailable: There are no available policy sets...

edit.selectResourceTypes: Select the resource types to be available within this policy set.
edit.cannotEditPolicySet: To edit a policy set first delete all policies that it contains.

edit.resourcesDescription: Specify resources to be managed with this policy.
edit.actionsDescription: Select the actions that the policy applies.
edit.subjectConditionsDescription: Specify the subject conditions to which the policy applies.
edit.environmentConditionsDescription: Specify the environment conditions to which the policy applies.
edit.deleteLogical: Deleting will also remove any child objects
edit.selectResourceTypeHelper: Select the type of resource for which this policy will manage access.
edit.subjectAttributesPlaceholder: Select or search for subject attributes
edit.canAcceptOneChild: The "Not..." logical operator can only accept one child

AuthLevel.title: Authentication Level (greater than or equal to)

LEAuthLevel.title: Authentication Level (less than or equal to)

SimpleTime.title: Time (day, date, time, and timezone)
SimpleTime.helperContent: Must contain one or more of the following values: Time (Start and End), Day (Start and End), Date (Start and End) and/or Time Zone.

conditionTypes.ipHelperContent: Enter at least one of Start IP, End IP or DNS Name. To match a single IP, enter it in either Start IP or End IP. Start IP must be less than or equal to End IP. DNS Name is an explicit match, or you can use a wildcard in the lowest sub-domain.
conditionTypes.legacyFormat: This condition is in a legacy format, and should be replaced.

list.description: Create, edit or delete authorization policies that apply to this policy set.
list.noPolicies: You haven't added any policies to this set yet.

edit.actionsDescription: Define the actions that policies using this resource type can allow or deny.
edit.patternsDescription: Define resource patterns that policies using this resource type can expand upon.
edit.noResourceTypesMessage: You must add a Resource Type to create a Policy Set.
